B2 informal (of places and things) expensive and of high quality: He takes her to some really posh restaurants.

C2 UK informal (of people and their voices) from a high social class: A woman with a very posh accent phoned for him earlier. too posh to push UK informal humorous
used for describing a woman from a high social class who chooses to have a caesarean section (= a medical operation) to have her baby: Researchers did not find much evidence of the so-called "too posh to push" phenomenon.
